meanings.definition: Capable of being stretched or expanded.
meanings.sent1: The rubber band was dilatable, so I could stretch it easily.
meanings.sent2: The balloon was dilatable, allowing it to grow bigger as we blew air into it.
meanings.sent3: The dilatable pants saved the day when I accidentally ate too much at the buffet.
meanings.sent4: Her dilatable imagination knew no bounds, creating endless possibilities in her stories.
meanings.sent5: The dilatable fabric clung to her body, molding perfectly to her shape.

meanings.definition: Able to be widened or enlarged.
meanings.sent1: The dilatable road could accommodate more lanes during rush hour.
meanings.sent2: The dilatable doorway allowed for larger furniture to be moved in and out of the room.
meanings.sent3: The dilatable smile on his face grew even wider when he saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: Her dilatable influence in the community expanded as more people joined her cause.
meanings.sent5: The dilatable garden expanded its borders, welcoming new flowers and plants.
